resources.string: The World is already in auto sync
The World is already in manual sync
Your Dropbox account has been successfully linked.\n\nPlease select one of the two options to finish the configuration or press the \"back\" button from your device if you want to ignore this step.
This option replaces the worlds in your device with the content from your Dropbox account.
This option replaces the worlds in your Dropbox account with the content from your device.
In order to keep your Minecraft worlds in the cloud, Mine Sync uses the service provided from Dropbox. This option will link the application to your Dropbox account.

Dropbox is a file hosting service. It allows users to create a special folder on each of their computers, which Dropbox then synchronizes so that it appears to be the same folder (with the same contents) regardless of which computer is used to view it.
Unlink means that the connection between Mine Sync and your Dropbox account will be broken. This way the application won\'t be able to save your worlds in the cloud.

It shows the current status of the connection to your Dropbox account. \"Not linked\" means that the application has not been yet connected to your Dropbox account. \"Linked to\" plus \"your name\" means that the application is linked to the given Dropbox account.

It shows the application\'s last action. This could be either a world \"save\" or a world \"update\". World \"save\" means that a local world was uploaded to the cloud. World \"update\" means that the world was downloaded from the cloud because it was changed by another of your devices.

Mine Sync creates a permanent entry in the notification drawer. This notification has an icon that remains in colour if the sync service is running in the background keeping your worlds up-to-date.
By clicking the "Pause" button the sync service stops and your worlds won't get updated with new versions coming from your other devices. When the sync service is stopped the notification icon turns colourless. By clicking the "Play" button the sync service is activated again.

An extra notification will show every time that a world gets updated. This means that a world was modified in other device and the change was already taken in the current device and you can already play it.

In the \"Activity\" section you can see what changes your worlds have been through.\nWorlds marked in green were updated in the device. Under the world\'s name you can see when the process took place and the world\'s size when it happend.\nWorlds marked in blue were saved to Dropbox. Under the world\'s name you can see when the process took place and the world\'s size when it happend.

In the "Worlds" section you can see what Minecraft Worlds exist in the device.
Under the world's name you can see when Mine Sync saw the world for first time and in the right side you can see what's the world's current size.
Worlds marked in blue are automatically sync with the cloud, while worlds marked in gray are not.

You can modify the sync status by selecting a world and pressing the button in the top right side of the screen (a white cloud with an inner spinning arrow).

Selecting a world and pressing to the white cloud with an upwards green arrow will save the world to the cloud, while pressing the white cloud with a downwards blue arrow will download it.
Worlds got remotely updated, please refresh list
From now on \"Mine Sync\" will run in the background, keeping your Minecraft worlds always synced in your Dropbox account.
Minecraft PE not found.\nPlease install Minecraft PE to continue.
